text: Among the selected countries, Canada has the highest per capita electricity consumption, ranging from 15,556 kWh in Calendar Year 2018 to 14,148 kWh in Calendar Year 2023. In contrast, the world average has grown from 3,287 kWh in Calendar Year 2018 to 3,486 kWh in Calendar Year 2022. China's per capita electricity consumption has been steadily increasing, It has increased from 4,842 kWh in Calendar Year 2018 to 6,112 kWh in Calendar Year 2022 while India's has shown moderate growth, growing from 1,181 kWh in Fiscal 2019 to 1,395 kWh in Fiscal 2024.
Per capita electricity consumption across countries (kWh) (Fiscal 2019 to Fiscal 2024, Calendar Year 2018 to Calendar Year 2023)
India numbers are as per CEA, rest of the numbers are as per World Bank / IEA
Source: World Bank, IEA, CEA, Crisil Intelligence
Renewable energy to account for approximately 50% of India's installed capacity by fiscal 2032
